meanings.definition: Organisms that thrive in extreme environments.
meanings.sent1: Extremophiles are tiny creatures that love living in very harsh places.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study extremophiles to understand how life can survive in extreme conditions.
meanings.sent3: The extremophiles had a party in the scorching desert, dancing under the blazing sun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of extremophiles, surviving in boiling hot springs is like a walk in the park.
meanings.sent5: The extremophiles in the icy Antarctic waters are like superheroes of the microscopic world.

meanings.definition: An extremophile is a microorganism that lives in conditions of extreme temperature, acidity, alkalinity, or chemical concentration.
meanings.sent1: Extremophiles are tiny organisms that can withstand extreme heat or cold.
meanings.sent2: Researchers have discovered extremophiles thriving in highly acidic environments.
meanings.sent3: The extremophiles threw a pool party in the acidic lake, sipping lemonade and enjoying the view.
meanings.sent4: Surviving in extreme conditions, extremophiles are like the daredevils of the microbial world.
meanings.sent5: The extremophiles in the toxic waste dump are like fearless pioneers exploring new frontiers.
